intro: Fadogia leucophloea, commonly known as the white phloem tree, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, often fragrant flowers. The tree is notable for its thick, white inner bark, which is a key feature of its common name. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
